012package org.postgresql.pljava.example.annotation;
013
014import java.sql.Connection;
015import java.sql.DriverManager;
016import java.sql.Statement;
017import java.sql.PreparedStatement;
018import java.sql.ResultSet;
019import java.sql.SQLException;
020
021import org.postgresql.pljava.ResultSetHandle;
022
023import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.Function;
024import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.SQLAction;
025
026/**
027 * Demonstrate holdability of ResultSets (test for issue 168).
028 *<p>
029 * The {@code stashResultSet} method will execute a query and save its
030 * {@code ResultSet} (wrapped in a {@code ResultSetHandle} in a static
031 * for later retrieval. The {@code unstashResultSet} method, called later
032 * in the same transaction, retrieves and returns the result set. A call after
033 * the transaction has ended will fail.
034 *<p>
035 * The query selects all rows from {@code pg_description}, a table that should
036 * always exist, with more rows than the default connection {@code fetchSize},
037 * to ensure the stashed {@code ResultSet} has work to do.
038 */
039@SQLAction(requires={"Holdability.stash", "Holdability.unstash"}, install={
040
041    "SELECT javatest.stashResultSet()",
042
043    "SELECT " +
044    " CASE" +
045    "  WHEN 1000 < count(*) THEN javatest.logmessage('INFO', 'Holdability OK')"+
046    "  ELSE javatest.logmessage('WARNING', 'Holdability suspicious')" +
047    " END" +
048    " FROM javatest.unstashResultSet()"
049})
050public class Holdability implements ResultSetHandle
051{
052    private static Holdability s_stash;
053
054    private ResultSet m_resultSet;
055    private Statement m_stmt;
056
057    private Holdability(Statement s, ResultSet rs)
058    {
059        m_stmt = s;
060        m_resultSet = rs;
061    }
062
063    /**
064     * Query all rows from {@code pg_description}, but stash the
065     * {@code ResultSet} for retrieval later in the same transaction by
066     * {@code unstashResultSet}.
067     *<p>
068     * This must be called in an open, multiple-statement (non-auto) transaction
069     * to have any useful effect.
070     */
071    @Function(schema="javatest", provides="Holdability.stash")
072    public static void stashResultSet() throws SQLException
073    {
074        Connection c = DriverManager.getConnection("jdbc:default:connection");
075        PreparedStatement s = c.prepareStatement(
076            "SELECT * FROM pg_catalog.pg_description");
077        ResultSet rs = s.executeQuery();
078        s_stash = new Holdability(s, rs);
079    }
080
081    /**
082     * Return the results stashed earlier in the same transaction by
083     * {@code stashResultSet}.
084     */
085    @Function(
086        schema="javatest",
087        type="pg_catalog.pg_description",
088        provides="Holdability.unstash"
089    )
090    public static ResultSetHandle unstashResultSet() throws SQLException
091    {
092        return s_stash;
093    }
094
095    /*
096     * Necessary methods to implement ResultSetHandle follow.
097     */
098
099    @Override
100    public ResultSet getResultSet() throws SQLException
101    {
102        return m_resultSet;
103    }
104
105    @Override
106    public void close() throws SQLException
107    {
108        Connection c = m_stmt.getConnection();
109        m_stmt.close();
110        c.close();
111    }
112}
